page.title: 14West Wratting: Lifestyle
page.content: In our interviewee's garden there is a little of everything. Single rows of a wide variety of vegetables, some to use now,some to eat through the winter. Some did well this year, some not so well. The outdoor tomatoes were very late, but the greens and leeks look good for the winter and there's a nice crop of mangol (wurzles) for the four tame sheep he always keeps. He grew a couple of sunflowers again for the chickens, but they aren't much good, which is a shame - the chickens love them. He isn't exactly a "kept man" but freely admits that his wife earns more than he does. She works for a big meat production company in Haverhill. The suggestion of retirement next year is quickly dismissed. He loves the garden which he is employed to maintain and would miss his job dearly.
